author: Staff Reporter
text:
Trains will be diverted via Tiruchi-Karur-Dindigul route due to track and signal modernisation works for track doubling between Tiruchi and Manapparai.

The trains to be diverted are: Train No. 16128/16127 Chennai Egmore– Guruvayoor Guruvayoor Express will be diverted from March 27 to March 31; Train No. 16352 Nagercoil– Mumbai CST Express will be diverted on March 31; Train No. 16354 Nagercoil–Kacheguda Express will be diverted on March 29; and Train No. 16353 Kacheguda– Nagercoil Express on March 30, says a release from Thiruvananthapuram Divisional Railway.

The release said that additional 3 tier AC coach would be permanently augmented in Train No. 17235/17236 Bengaluru Express from August 2 from Nagercoil junction and from August 3 from Bengaluru. Another release said that a special train (No . 06011) would be operated from Krishnarajapuram at 11.10 hrs on all Mondays between April 11 and June 27. The train would reach Nagercoil junction at 04.15 hrs on Tuesdays.

The train would have one 2 AC, three 3 AC and 12 sleeper class coaches and would stop at Erniel, Kulithurai, Neyyatinkara, Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Kayamkulam, Chengannur, Thiruvalla, Kottayam, Ernakulam Town, Aluva, Thrissur, Palakkad, Coimbatore and Erode stations.

For track and

signal modernisation between Tiruchi and Manapparai
title: Trains to be diverted
